 The NDP would likely be considered the communist party of Canada by most Americans. 
 
 They are EXTREMELY socialist in their ideology, to the point that the vast majority of Canadians dismiss them as being a legitimate option as a governing party.
 
 An electoral college, or some system that would place more emphasis on regional poloitical preference has been discussed at length, especially by those outside of central Canada (Ontario and Quebec), but little has or will come of it. The current system does give equal representation in gov't according to population. On that basis, it's very fair, unfortunately, Canada's population is centered in Ontario and Quebec, and that leads to those areas outside the population center (western Canada and the Maritimes), often with differing views, largely at the mercy of the majority.
